attributes.text:
The json data store is responsible for fetching data from a url. The type of the data has to be json.

The loaded data will be parsed and saved in qooxdoo objects. Every value of the loaded data will be stored in a qooxdoo property. The model classes for the data will be created automatically.

For the fetching itself it uses the {@link qx.io.remote.Request} class and for parsing the loaded javascript objects into qooxdoo objects, the {@link qx.data.marshal.Json} class will be used.
The url where to find the data.
The delegate containing one of the methods specified in {@link qx.data.store.IStoreDelegate}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #model}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #state}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #url}.
Data event fired after the model has been created. The data will be the created model.
The event fired by the request.
Handler for the completion of the requests. It invokes the creation of the needed classes and instances for the fetched data using {@link qx.data.marshal.Json}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property url.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyUrl}.
The url for the request.
Creates and sends a GET request with the given url. Additionally two listeners will be added for the state and the completed event of the request.

Returns the (computed) value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
(Computed) value of model.

Returns the (computed) value of the property state.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.
(Computed) value of state.

Returns the (computed) value of the property url.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.
(Computed) value of url.
Initial value for property model.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property model with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
the default value
Initial value for property state.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property state with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.
the default value
Initial value for property url.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property url with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.
the default value
Reloads the data with the url set in the {@link #url} property.

Resets the user value of the property model.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

Resets the user value of the property state.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.

Resets the user value of the property url.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.
New value for property model.

Sets the user value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property state.

Sets the user value of the property state.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property url.

Sets the user value of the property url.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.
The unmodified incoming value.
Property for holding the loaded model instance.
The state of the request as an url. If you want to check if the request did his job, use, the {@link #changeState} event and check for one of the listed values.
The url where the request should go to.
